Crimes.Dispute_Type: Residency obligation appeal with humanitarian and compassionate grounds
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the Board committed an error of law or made a patently unreasonable finding of fact
Crimes.Outcome: Application allowed, case remanded for redetermination
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Applicant's credibility questioned due to inconsistencies in travel, employment, and financial records
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Overly harsh assessment ignoring relevant evidence
Crimes.Proceeding_Type: Appeal before the Immigration Appeal Division
Crimes.Application_Error: Failure to consider relevant evidence and overemphasis on lifestyle
Crimes.Review_Outcome: Remanded for reconsideration by a different Board member
Crimes.Assessment_Standard: Patent unreasonableness standard applied to factual findings
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Error of law and patently unreasonable factual findings
Crimes.Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Section 28, IRPA – Residency requirement (730 days in 5 years)
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Failure to meet residency obligations due to conflicting evidence and misinterpretation of facts
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Inconsistent documentation and selective dismissal of supporting evidence
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Concerns about unfair treatment due to disregard of credible evidence
Crimes.Document_Fraud: Alleged misrepresentation in border and residency documents
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Doubts raised about truthfulness of applicant’s explanations and records
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Appeal based on humanitarian and compassionate grounds
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Improper evaluation of evidence by the Board
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to account for documented periods of presence in Canada

Crimes.Crime_Name: Failure to comply with residency obligations
Crimes.Violation_Type: Failure to meet physical presence requirement
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the Board made a patently unreasonable finding of fact regarding residency compliance
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicant provided conflicting evidence on Canadian presence; credibility concerns over travel, employment, and finances
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Loss of permanent resident status affirmed initially, later set aside
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Judicial review and reinstatement of permanent resident status
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Permanent resident appealing loss of status
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Provided inconsistent records; some credible evidence overlooked
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Physical presence in Canada for at least 730 days in five years
Crimes.Applicable_Legislation: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, Section 28
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Improper handling and dismissal of evidence by the Board
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Negative credibility findings due to inconsistencies
Crimes.Application_Basis: Appeal based on failure to meet residency requirements
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Lack of consistent documentation to prove presence
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Risk of losing permanent resident status
Crimes.Cause_Description: Applicant failed to meet residency requirements due to conflicting evidence
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: Selective reliance on negative indicators while ignoring supportive data
Crimes.Residency_Compliance: Not met according to initial Board assessment
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Insufficient weight given to corroborative evidence
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Focus on inconsistencies despite existence of objective proof
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to consider all relevant evidence objectively

Crimes.Legal_Issue: Reasonableness of the Board’s factual findings on residency
Crimes.Procedural_Stage: Judicial review of administrative appeal decision
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Conflicting travel, employment, and financial records evaluated
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to demonstrate compliance with residency obligations
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: Inconsistencies in financial and travel documentation
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Failure to properly assess available evidence
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Deficient due to dismissal of relevant evidence
Crimes.Defendant_Response: Submitted documents to prove presence but faced credibility issues
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Judicial review and restoration of status
Crimes.Applicable_Process: Administrative appeal followed by judicial review

Crimes.Violation_Type: Irrelevant consideration of occupation in residency assessment
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the Board erred by disregarding relevant evidence due to applicant’s profession
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicant worked as a loan shark; credible evidence (bank statements, vet visits) dismissed based on profession
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Adverse decision set aside on review
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Judicial review and reinstatement of status
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Permanent resident appealing loss of status
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Engaged in loan sharking, which was improperly used to discredit residency evidence
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Humanitarian and compassionate grounds; procedural unfairness
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Relevance of evidence to physical presence in Canada
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Consideration of irrelevant factors in decision-making
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Unduly influenced by applicant’s occupation rather than evidence
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Objective records showing presence in Canada
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: None proven; contrary, evidence was ignored
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Unfair denial of permanent resident status
Crimes.Cause_Description: Appeal due to non-compliance allegations despite supporting evidence
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Relevant evidence improperly dismissed due to moral judgment
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: Failure to consider objective evidence independent of character
Crimes.Misrepresentation_Element: Not applicable – issue was evidentiary bias
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Scope of Board’s authority to consider character vs. evidence
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Flawed due to focus on loan sharking instead of presence
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Moral disapproval improperly substituted for factual analysis
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Exclusion of reliable third-party records without justification
